Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide -- Health Unit 3.11 Mills - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION
 (HEALTH UNIT)
(TAX CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR 3.11 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION FOR FURNISHING THE PARISH'S PORTION OF FUNDS TO IMPROVE, MAINTAIN AND OPERATE THE VERNON PARISH HEALTH UNIT AND OTHER RELATED PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIVITIES AND IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE PARISH ANIMAL SHELTER.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Vernon, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to continue to levy a three and eleven hundredths (3.11) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $312,000) on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of furnishing the Parish's portion of funds to maintain and operate the Vernon Parish Health Unit and other related public health activities and improving, maintaining and operating the Parish animal shelter?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road District No. Five -- Prop.#1 - 6.07 Mill - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1
(TAX CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR 6.07 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION FOR MAINTAINING PARISH ROADS AND BRIDGES WITHIN ROAD DISTRICT NO 5.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. Five, Vernon Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a six and seven hundredths (6.07) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $103,000) on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of maintaining Parish roads and bridges within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road District No. Five -- Prop.#2 - 2.43 Mill - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2 
(TAX CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR 2.43 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION FOR CONSTRUCTING AND IMPROVING PARISH ROADS AND BRIDGES WITHIN ROAD DISTRICT NO. 5.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. Five, Vernon Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a two and forty-three hundredths (2.43) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $41,000) on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018 for the purpose of constructing and improving Parish roads and bridges within the District?

Race.SummaryText:
WARD THREE WARDWIDE SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 160 PROPOSITION
(BOND)
 
SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO ISSUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,875,000 OF 30 YEAR GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS WITH THE PROCEEDS OF THE BONDS TO BE USED FOR THE PURPOSE OF IMPROVING BUILDING SITES AND PLAYGROUNDS, INCLUDING CONSTRUCTION OF NECESSARY SIDEWALKS AND STREETS ADJACENT THERETO; PURCHASING, ERECTING, RENOVATING AND/OR IMPROVING SCHOOL BUILDINGS AND OTHER SCHOOL RELATED FACILITIES WITHIN AND FOR THE DISTRICT, AND ACQUIRING THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT AND FURNISHINGS THEREFOR, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC, TO BE PAID FROM AD VALOREM TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall Ward Three Wardwide School District No. 160 of Vernon Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Two Million Eight Hundred Seventy-Five Thousand Dollars ($2,875,000), to be issued in series from time to time, to run not exceeding thirty (30) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting, renovating and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
